content.rendered:
• Home
  • India
  • Kailash Mansarovar Yatra

Kailash Mansarovar Yatra

Considered the ultimate pilgrimage among devout Hindus and Shaivites this potentially life-changing yatra can be one of the most spiritual experiences you can have.Read More

People going on this sacred and holy yatra are required to take a parikrama (walk around) of the Kailasha Parbat which is extremely testing and can take a toll on your health conditions. It is not only a vital pilgrimage destination for just Hindus but it is also visited by people from various different religions that are Jains, Buddhists as well as Bons. Despite the unexpected and difficult situations people readily avail the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra Packages.

If you want to experience this spirituality and take a trip to the seat of Lord Shiva, we bring you a range of convenient tour packages that are affordable and pocket-friendly, and curated with immense care. From the 12 days of Kailash yatra from Kathmandu to the 10 days of Kailash yatra from Nepalgunj and more, you will be able to feel the vitality and presence of the Lord himself. You will also be performing the ancient ritual of circumambulating the holy mountain and achieving some enlightenment.

For 12 to 10 days you will be immersed in an incredibly sacred, auspicious, and self-enlightening experience. Another essential and spiritual aspect of this mountain range is Lake Mansarovar which is situated right on the foothills of the mountain. The gleaming and shimmering blue water of this lake is used by the pilgrims and devotees here to cleanse themselves of all their sins. Evoke a sense of some deep spirituality and love for the lord by availing any one of our holy tour packages which are created with the aim of providing you with a wholesome and spiritual experience.

FAQs for Kailash Mansarovar Yatra

Q1: How Difficult Is The Yatra To Kailash Mansarovar?

A. The Yatra itself is not difficult, but the long distances will exhaust you. On average, you must travel between 15 and 18 kilometers per day, but one day you must travel 27 kilometers. However, the natural beauty along this route is unparalleled anywhere in the world. Throughout the Yatra, Indian Army personnel will be with you at all times.

Q2. How Do I Get Ready For The Kailash Mansarovar Trek?

  • 30-45 days prior to the start of this trip, switch to 70% liquid and raw food.
  • Take only one proper meal per day, which could be your lunch.
  • Make an effort to consume at least 4 liters of water per day.
  • Drink water every 10 minutes while on the hike.

Q. What Is Mansarovar's Specialty?

A. Lake Manasarovar, about 2000 kilometers from Lhasa, is the world's highest freshwater lake. Mount Kailash Parvat, also known as Lake Manasarovar in Sanskrit and Mapham Yutso in Tibetan, is a massive lake with a mirror-like reflection of snow-capped mountains in its crystal clear waters.

Q. What Is The Kailash Mountain's Secret?

A. Mount Kailash is surrounded by two lakes: Mansarovar and Rakshas Tal. The two lakes are thought to represent yin and yang; one is shaped like the Sun, while the other resembles the Moon; one is freshwater, while the other is saltwater.

Q. When Is The Best Time To Go On The Kailash Mansarovar Yatra?

A. Summer and monsoon season, generally from May to mid-October, are the best times to visit Kailash Mansarovar. It is an excellent time for outdoor activities such as trekking and pilgrimage, as well as visiting nearby tourist attractions.
